questions.question: What is the most effective way to prevent SQL injection attacks?
options: Using regular expressions to sanitize input
Employing client-side validation
Using prepared statements with parameterized queries
Limiting the length of input
questions.answer: Using prepared statements with parameterized queries

questions.question: Explain the importance of input validation in secure coding.
questions.answer: Input validation is crucial in secure coding to ensure that only properly formatted data is entered into a system. This helps prevent attacks such as SQL injection, cross-site scripting, and command injection, which exploit input vulnerabilities to compromise security.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common secure coding practice?
options: Hardcoding sensitive information
Using encryption for data at rest and in transit
Avoiding version control
None of the above
questions.answer: Using encryption for data at rest and in transit

questions.question: Why is it important to keep software and libraries up-to-date?
options: To ensure compatibility with other programs
To maintain software performance
To patch security vulnerabilities
All of the above

questions.question: Which of the following practices is NOT recommended for secure coding?
options: Regularly using static code analysis tools
Storing sensitive information in source code
Implementing proper error handling
Following the principle of least privilege
questions.answer: Storing sensitive information in source code

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a social engineering attack?
options: DDoS attack
Phishing
SQL Injection
Buffer Overflow

questions.question: What action can individuals take to prevent becoming a victim of ransomware?
options: Opening email attachments from unknown senders
Downloading software from reputable sites only
Using the same password for multiple accounts
Ignoring software update notifications
questions.answer: Downloading software from reputable sites only

questions.question: Describe a man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack and how to prevent it.
questions.answer: A man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack occurs when an attacker intercepts communication between two parties to steal or manipulate the data. Preventing MITM attacks involves using encrypted connections (e.g., HTTPS), employing VPN services for secure communication, and educating users on the importance of secure connections.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a firewall?
options: Monitoring network traffic
Blocking unauthorized access while permitting outward communication
Encrypting personal data
Detecting and removing viruses and other malware
questions.answer: Blocking unauthorized access while permitting outward communication

questions.question: Which of the following is a secure practice for managing passwords?
options: Using the same password for multiple accounts for easy recall
Writing down passwords and keeping them under the keyboard
Using long, complex passwords and a reputable password manager
Sharing passwords with trusted colleagues for backup
questions.answer: Using long, complex passwords and a reputable password manager
